body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug

**What happened**:

I get a "failed to prepare subPath for volumeMount" error (CreateContainerConfigError) when trying to deploy on a 1.9.6-gke.1 node.

**What you expected to happen**:

I should be able to use subPaths on volume mounts, especially because the entire disk is read-only.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

```
apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
    name: fomopop-website-deployment
spec:
    replicas: 3
    template:
        spec:
            containers:
                - name: fomopop-website
                  image: gcr.io/fomopop-disco-beach/fomopop-website:2018-04-17-12-05
                  volumeMounts:
                      - name: fomopop-sheet-music
                        subPath: website/content
                        mountPath: /app/website/content
                      - name: fomopop-sheet-music
                        subPath: website/thumbs
                        mountPath: /app/website/thumbs
                      - name: fomopop-sheet-music
                        subPath: website/site/accounts
                        mountPath: /app/website/accounts
            volumes:
                - name: fomopop-sheet-music
                  gcePersistentDisk:
                      pdName: fomopop-sheet-music-2018-04-17-12-08
                      fsType: ext4
                      readOnly: true
```

**Anything else we need to know?**:
Everything works fine on 1.9.3-gke.0 nodes.

Based on one error log message, it seems like there is a regression in previous defined/undefined behavior with regards to readOnly volumes. The **volume** I am attempting to mount subPaths from is readOnly. However, I previously _did not_ specify that the individual **volumeMounts** should be readOnly; I assumed it was obvious/clear that if the source volume is readOnly, then the mount should be readOnly.

I've tried to add `readOnly: true` to the volumeMounts, but that gives no improvement. The logs still indicate that it's trying to mount it as read-write when it (probably?) shouldn't.

Error logs from node:

2018-04-17 14:17:33.000 PDT
E0417 21:17:33.301247 1331 pod_workers.go:186] Error syncing pod 4d1cf26c-4283-11e8-8e1a-42010a800150 ("fomopop-website-deployment-74cbf44bb9-8vgxl_default(4d1cf26c-4283-11e8-8e1a-42010a800150)"), skipping: failed to "StartContainer" for "fomopop-website" with CreateContainerConfigError: "failed to prepare subPath for volumeMount \"fomopop-sheet-music\" of container \"fomopop-website\""

2018-04-17 14:17:46.000 PDT
E0417 21:17:46.306213 1331 kuberuntime_manager.go:734] container start failed: CreateContainerConfigError: failed to prepare subPath for volumeMount "fomopop-sheet-music" of container "fomopop-website"

2018-04-17 14:18:13.000 PDT
E0417 21:18:13.296460 1331 kuberuntime_manager.go:734] container start failed: CreateContainerConfigError: failed to prepare subPath for volumeMount "fomopop-sheet-music" of container "fomopop-website"

2018-04-17 14:18:37.000 PDT
E0417 21:18:37.295800 1331 pod_workers.go:186] Error syncing pod 4d1cf26c-4283-11e8-8e1a-42010a800150 ("fomopop-website-deployment-74cbf44bb9-8vgxl_default(4d1cf26c-4283-11e8-8e1a-42010a800150)"), skipping: failed to "StartContainer" for "fomopop-website" with CreateContainerConfigError: "failed to prepare subPath for volumeMount \"fomopop-sheet-music\" of container \"fomopop-website\""
